description: The 2021 Toyota Camry sits near the top of our midsize car rankings. It boasts a generous list of standard safety tech, straightforward infotainment controls, a gentle ride, sharp steering, and a potent engine option.
The world's most popular SUV, the mid-sized Nissan X-Trail is spacious and good to drive, with all but the least costly variant offering part-leather trim and satellite navigation.
The Volkswagen Golf is one incredibly popular compact car with great ratings and great reviews.
Civic fans praise the compact car for its fuel efficiency, practicality, low maintenance, quality engineering, and reliability.
A smooth, quiet diesel engine, along with bags of room and refined styling, make this a credible contender in the SUV market.
The Suzuki Jimny is a line of four-wheel drive off-road mini SUVs, manufactured and marketed by Japanese automaker Suzuki since April 1970, and now in its fourth generation.
The 2021 Mercedes-Benz GLC is a good luxury compact SUV. The GLC has a sumptuous and quiet interior with comfy seats, room for five occupants, and a sizable cargo area.
The Hyundai Sonata Reliability Rating is 4.0 out of 5.0, which ranks it 5th out of 24 for midsize cars.
The Jeep Cherokee is a line of SUVs manufactured and marketed by Jeep over five generations.
BMW's 320i has long been a popular entry-level prestige machine and, with its good looks, build quality, and engineering.
